titles.title: Making further continuing appropriations for the fiscal year 2003, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Appropriations.

Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 585 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 123 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. H. Res. 550, H. Res. 551, and H. Res. 577 are laid on the table.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 585.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 123 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments. H. Res. 550, H. Res. 551, and H. Res. 577 are laid on the table.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 123.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
Mr. Obey moved to recommit with instructions to Appropriations.
Floor summary: DEBATE - The House proceeded with 10 minutes of debate on the motion to recommit with instructions.
The previous question on the motion to recommit with instructions was ordered without objection.
On motion to recommit with instructions Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 194 - 210 (Roll no. 469).

vote.text: On passage Passed by recorded vote: 228 - 172 (Roll no. 470).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

vote.text: Received in the Senate, read twice, considered, read the third time, and passed without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

bill.summary: 10/16/2002--Passed House without amendment. Amends Public Law 107-229 to extend until November 22, 2002, specified continuing appropriations for FY 2003.
